definitions: To turn something, especially repeatedly, around a central point or axis.
To turn your body or part of your body into a different position.
To change the original meaning or intention of something, often in a misleading way.
To form something by winding separate threads or strands together.
To injure a part of your body, especially an ankle or wrist, by turning it awkwardly.
examples: She twisted her hair into a bun.
He twisted his body to look behind him.
They twist the fibers into strong rope.
I twisted my ankle playing soccer.
